history.content: Just go for it and apply! It never hurts to try and the worst thing that can happen is that you get rejected. My perspective is that it’s less competitive because a good portion of people who would usually take up those spots might be away from Berkeley doing internships, studying abroad, etc. CS 370 is a good class to take and I would recommend it if you want teaching experience, but I’ve met people who became TAs without ever taking the class, so it’s not like it’s necessary to take it to be a part of course staff. I think the grade cutoff depends on the course and instructor. Some professors have stricter standards than others. The general GPA cutoff is 3.0.

children.subject: would highly recommend joining summer course staff if you can, one of my favorite experiences at Berkeley so far. lots of my friends took 370 during the summer or the following fall, I wouldn't say it's a requirement though it does help (I took it the previous spring). around ~23% of applicants were hired for the class I was on staff for (this is including tutors + tas).
When will the Summer 2019 applications open for joining course staff?

history.content:
I am a first year and an AI for CS 61A. I am interested in eventually becoming a TA/uGSI for a CS course, but I am not sure how to best go about this. 

I am planning on taking a summer class, so I want to work on course staff for 61B over the summer to add one or two units. Should I apply to a tutor/reader position for 61B, or just stick to being an AI for another semester? I'm not sure how competitive it is to get a paid position over the summer, so I was hoping someone could let me know if it is reasonable to apply for one. I have not taken cS 370. Also, I saw on the course staff site that the cutoff for being a uGSI is usually an A- in the class, but is there a general GPA cutoff as well?
history.subject: Joining course staff over the summer/in general
